official-title.#text: Establishing a select committee to investigate and report on the surveillance operations of the National Security Agency.

text.#text: There is established a select committee to investigate and report on the surveillance operations of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in the case of a chair, or the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: after consultation with the minority leader in the case of a ranking member, shall designate the member or members from that committee to serve on the select committee.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

continuation-text.#text: If the chair or ranking member of any such committee declines to serve on the select committee, then the

text.#text: The select committee shall be composed of 19 members as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on—

text.#text:
Not later than 90 days
			 after the initial meeting of the select committee, the select committee shall
			 conduct an investigation of and submit to the

header.#text: Investigation and report on the surveillance operations of the National Security Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: violated the rights of American citizens in its surveillance operations;
about the
activities;

text.#text: any improper conduct by officials in the conducting of the surveillance operations or in reporting to

recommendations on what steps can be taken to better guard American citizens’ rights from unconstitutional surveillance operations and what further minimization procedures, if any, should be employed by intelligence agencies to ensure American citizens’ constitutional rights are protected;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: surveillance operations is best suited to protect national security; and

text.#text: whether the large scope of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: surveillance operations.

text.#text: any other relevant issues relating to the

Rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives, including clause 2(j)(1) (guaranteeing the minority additional witnesses) and clause 2(m)(3) (providing for the authority to subpoena witnesses and documents), shall apply to the select committee.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, may
			 consult with the chair of any Senate committee conducting a parallel
			 investigation regarding meeting jointly to receive testimony, the scheduling of
			 hearings or issuance of subpoenas, and joint staff interviews of key
			 witnesses.
